intro: Pomaderris helianthemifolia subsp. helianthemifolia, commonly known as the golden pomaderris, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to sunny to partially shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening.
